borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p>The
proposal, by reason of siting, mass and design, would be an
undesirable addition which would create a new discordant frontage along a section of Sylvan Avenue which is characterised by its openness and would appear at odds within the rear garden setting. As such, it fails to respect or reflect the character of the host dwelling, local area and street scene along Sylvan Avenue, causing harm to each of these. The proposal thus fails to accord with the
following policies which seek to ensure development proposals are well
designed, suitable for the site and local context, and respect and reflect the existing character:
</p><ul><li>

 Paragraph
     130 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning
     Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)
</li><li> Policies D3, D4 and D6 of
     the London Plan (March 2021)
</li><li> Policies
     CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
     (July 2010)
</li><li> Policies&nbsp;BP8
     and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide
     Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)
</li><li> Policies
     SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft
     Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
</li></ul>
description: Demolition of existing garage and the construction of a new two storey 2x bedroom dwellinghouse to the rear of 61 Kings Avenue, RM6 6BD

constraints_details.result: 61 Kings Avenue, Chadwell Heath, Romford, Barking And Dagenham, RM6 6BD
